Decommission Unix servers

Steps to do prior

  1. Document all approvals from business, customers or other teams necessary.
  2. Discuss within the team and get an agreement.
  3. Create a Standard change control, get approval and do all the necessary paperwork.

Decommission - Day 1

  1. Communicate with all stake holders that the server and it's apps are being decommissioned.
  2. Have the application team stop all apps on the server
  3. If backups required, please ask DataPres team to backup the server with requested retention period.
  4. DRiV & Tenneco Servers follow the below steps and inform the team about the decommission
    1. Send an email to Monitoring team to stop monitoring.
    2. Send an email to Netbackup team to stop backing up the server.

Decommission - Day 2

  1. Make sure the backups are completed. It could be a day or two.
  2. Unmount & remove NFS mounts from clients when necessary and unexport the filesytems.
  3. Shutdown the server
  4. Remove The host from New Ansible tool. Follow the link Managing Hosts in Ansible provisioning tool

Decommission - Day 9

  1. Return the SAN storage after clearing PVIDs and destroying the VGDA.
  2. If this is a physical server,
    1. Send a ticket for cables reclamation and any storage zones etc to delete.
    2. Remove CDs/Tape media from the server.
    3. Unrack the server or pull out the blade.
  3. DRiV servers
    1. Remove the host from pcdcunxaxap01:/prod/images/etc/unix_sys_console
    2. Remove the host from pcdcunxaxap01:/prod/images/nimserver-utilities/Disaster.Recovery.List
    3. Remove the host from pcdcunxaxap01:/prod/images/nimserver-utilities/Disaster.Recovery.List
    4. Remove the host from PowerVM monitoring / LPAR2RRD - pcdcunxlxap02.
    5. Remove the mksysb backup files pcdcunxaxap01.
    6. Remove from NIM definitions pcdcunxaxap01.
  4. Tenneco servers
    1. Remove the host from pgnmsv01:/prod/images/etc/unix_sys_console
    2. Remove the host from pgnmsv01:/prod/images/nimserver-utilities/Disaster.Recovery.List
    3. Remove the host from penmsv01:/prod/images/nimserver-utilities/Disaster.Recovery.List
    4. Remove the host from PowerVM monitoring / LPAR2RRD.
    5. Remove the mksysb backup files.
    6. Remove from NIM definitions.
  5. Remove the LPAR/Blade/Frame as applicable.
  6. Remove the HMC/ILO network/VMWare as applicable.
  7. Request to remove from hardware maintenance. Email System model number and serial number to Robert - Not applicable if you are decommissioning .
  8. Send ticket to reclaim DNS names, IP addresses, network ports and cables to Network team.
  9. Goto service now and change the hardware status to retire for that server.
    1. Goto service now and search for server –> Click option All —> then in the name column type the decommissioning server
    2. Once you get the server change the status of the server to retire.
